title: Understanding Integrated Functioning
text: Integrated functioning refers to the process of bringing together different aspects of a person's identity, experiences, and functioning into a cohesive whole. It involves synthesizing these elements to create a harmonious and balanced sense of self.

hintAnswer: process of synthesizing different aspects of a person’s identity, experience, and functioning into a cohesive and harmonious whole
title: Components of Integrated Functioning
text: Consider the different aspects of a person's identity, experiences, and functioning. How might these be synthesized into a cohesive whole?
choices: unexpected or unplanned travel and amnesia regarding one’s identity, and $$\frac{depersonalization}{derealization}$$ disorder, marked by feelings of detachment from oneself or their surroundings
Dissociative Experiences Scale (DES) or the Structured Clinical Interview for Dissociative Disorders $$(SCID-D)$$
an alteration in the perception or experience of oneself, where an individual may feel detached or estranged from their thoughts, feelings, body, or actions
process of synthesizing different aspects of a person’s identity, experience, and functioning into a cohesive and harmonious whole
